preferences.cuisine: Farm-to-table, seasonal, quiet enough for conversation about books and teaching

success_criteria.notes: Success if the assistant books a dine-in reservation via make_reservation at one of the seeded farm-to-table or contemporary American restaurants in Portland for 3 people on the final agreed date (which the user will shift from next Friday to the following Saturday) between 18:30 and 20:30 local time. The reservation is for Maya (a literacy specialist from Portland planning a reflective dinner with two colleagues after a professional development workshop) and should prioritize a quieter atmosphere suitable for conversation.

injected_behaviors.instructions: After the assistant proposes options for next Friday, change the date preference from next Friday to the following Saturday because the university shifts the workshop schedule.

restaurants.name: Ink & Ember Kitchen
restaurants.notes: Cozy, book-lined walls, known for seasonal Oregon produce and a relatively quiet dining room before 20:00.

restaurants.name: Willamette Table
restaurants.notes: River-view, locally sourced menu, offers a "conversation corner" area on request for small groups.

restaurants.name: Chapter & Vine Bistro
restaurants.notes: Intimate bistro often hosting poetry readings on Sundays; Friday and Saturday evenings are calm before 19:30.

restaurants.name: Stanza Woodfire & Greens
restaurants.notes: Plant-forward menu, communal tables available for small academic groups, moderate noise level.
